metadata.title: CVE-2022-3125 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The Frontend File Manager Plugin WordPress plugin before 21.3 allows anyauthenticated users, such as subscriber, to rename a file to an arbitraryextension, like PHP, which could allow them to basically be able to uploadarbitrary files on the server and achieve RCE

criterions.comment: wordpress: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
